dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits swamps, lily ponds (Ref. 4967) and floodplains. Juveniles are found in interstitial pools in papyrus.  Browses on plant tissues with ostracods, dipteran larvae, beetles, mollusks and debris (Ref. 28714).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T. 2010. Ctenopoma muriei. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Ctenopoma muriei is known from Nigeria to Sudan, and south to Democratic Republic of Congo and Tanzania.

Central Africa: Ctenopoma muriei has been found on the Lualaba River. (Pauly et al. 1990, Gosse 1986, Norris 1992, Norris et al. 1988). One record has been made of the Bangweulu swamps and one from the Luombwa River, Luapula system. The records of the upper Lualaba and Luapula system are strange and could be a different species.

Eastern Africa: This species is known from the nothern end of Lake Tanganyika, the Rusizi River and its delta, the Malagarasi river system (De Vos et al. 2001) and, Lakes Victoria, Kyoga, Edward and Albert and their associated smaller lakes and streams.

Northeast Africa: It is present in the Ghazal and Jebel systems, and White Nile to Khartoum

Western Africa: Ctenopoma muriei occurs in the Lake Chad basin and eastern tributaries of the Niger River system (Benue River drainage).

agents.full_name: Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T.
Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Habitat and Ecology
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T. 2010. Ctenopoma muriei. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
Ctenopoma muriei is a benthopelagic species. It inhabits swamp, lily ponds (Eccles 1992) and floodplains, marginal vegetation along lake shores close to river deltas. Also inhabits streams and swamps both temporary and permanent (Greenwood 1966). Juveniles are found in interstitial pools in papyrus. Ctenopoma muriei browses on plant tissues with ostracods, dipteran larvae, beetles, molluscs and debris (Bailey 1994). It probably breeds in streams during the rainy season. It feeds on insect larvae and crustacea (Greenwood 1966). Larvae have been found in temporary streams together with sexually active adults suggesting that spawning takes place when such streams are flooded during the rainy season (Greenwood 1966).

Systems
  • Freshwater

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T. 2010. Ctenopoma muriei. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T.

Reviewer/s
Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.

Contributor/s

Justification
This species has a wide distribution, with no known major widespread threats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for eastern, north eastern and western Africa. The records of Ctenopoma muriei of the Congo River basin could be a different species. More information is needed on the species distribution before an assessment can be made, and so has regionally been categorised as Data Deficient for central Africa.

Population
In East Africa it is very rare in catches. No further information available.

Population Trend
Unknown

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Threats
dataObjects.title: Threats
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Awaïss, A., Getahun, A., Hanssens, M., Lalèyè, P. & Moelants, T. 2010. Ctenopoma muriei. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Major Threats
Regression of swamps biotopes due to farming extension threatens populations in eastern Africa. A major threat to west Africa is pollution due to oil exploration in Nigeria. Further threats are unknown.

None known. More research is needed into this species taxonomy, and population range and numbers
